newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht, interbank rate steady in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht, interbank rate steady in late trade.

text.p: The Thai baht steadied against the dollar onshore in quiet trade late on Wednesday as the U.S. unit moved narrowly abroad and dollar buying eased, dealers said.
The baht was quoted at 25.820/25.850 to the dollar late in the domestic market compared with 25.800/25.900 late on Tuesday.
"Dollar buying eased relatively today. But the baht was still traded low against the central bank's fixing on some commercial demand," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
The Bank of Thailand sets the midrate at 25.77 per dollar versus 25.78 on Tuesday.
In the offshore market, the baht was traded at 25.200/25.400 late against 25.100/25.300 in early morning.
The baht/dollar one-month swap was traded at 50/100 satangs per dollar late in the offshore market and 18/23 satangs in the domestic market.
The overnight interbank rate was quoted at 18/19 percent in late trade, unchanged from early trade.
